questions.text: Socrates left behind important philosophical writings.
Socrates was sentenced to death for corrupting the youth and impiety.
Socrates was born in Athens in the 5th century BCE.
Socrates believed that wisdom consisted in recognizing one's own ignorance.
The Oracle of Delphi declared Socrates the wisest man in Athens.
The main source of knowledge about Socrates comes from the dialogues written by Aristotle.
